en:
You are advised to limit your movements as much as possible and anyone who is not providing an essential service should stay at home. However, if someone needs a babysitter for their children and does not have access to day care or for whom the children cannot return to school, you may do so. The following conditions apply:
*   you are in good health,
*   no one has symptoms of fever, cough, difficulty breathing or sudden loss of smell without a stuffy nose, with or without loss of taste,
*   no one has been told to self-isolate,
*   no children in the family is going to school,
*   no one in the home is at risk (e.g., chronically ill or 70 years of age or older).
As far as possible, physical contact between children must be limited and they must be kept 2 metres apart. Regularly clean and disinfect high-touch surfaces and items, such as door handles, light switches, faucet handles, etc. If you must be in contact with children within 2 metres (e.g. infants), wear a face covering and wash your hands before and after taking the children. Clean bathrooms more frequently. Clean toys frequently, especially toys that children might put in their mouth. If you have been in close contact with children, change your clothes when you return home or when children leaves. Follow the [health recommendations for everyone](https://www.quebec.ca/en/health/health-issues/a-z/general-information-about-coronavirus/#c53183).
